intro: Moehringia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable moehringia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from linear to ovate, depending on environmental conditions. It produces small, pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Moehringia heterophylla typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats and is often found in open areas with well-drained soil.
